values.title: Use the same playmode names as SimSpark, fixes #18

values.description:
I have fixed a cosmetic issue in the gui plugin where the playmode in the gui combo box does not update when the server changes the playmode automatically. 

There is a style check warning with the line:

```
#!c++

  connect(this, SIGNAL(SetPlaymodeComboBox(int)),
          comboBox, SLOT(setCurrentIndex(int)), Qt::QueuedConnection);
```

But if I try changing it to

```
#!c++

  connect(this, SIGNAL(SetPlaymodeComboBox(int _index)),
          comboBox, SLOT(setCurrentIndex(int _index)), Qt::QueuedConnection);
```

the playmode update no longer works.
values.title: combo box now automatically updates to current playmode

summary.raw:
I have fixed a cosmetic issue in the gui plugin where the playmode in the gui combo box does not update when the server changes the playmode automatically. 

There is a style check warning with the line:

```
#!c++

  connect(this, SIGNAL(SetPlaymodeComboBox(int)),
          comboBox, SLOT(setCurrentIndex(int)), Qt::QueuedConnection);
```

But if I try changing it to

```
#!c++

  connect(this, SIGNAL(SetPlaymodeComboBox(int _index)),
          comboBox, SLOT(setCurrentIndex(int _index)), Qt::QueuedConnection);
```

the playmode update no longer works.
summary.html:
I have fixed a cosmetic issue in the gui plugin where the playmode in the gui combo box does not update when the server changes the playmode automatically.

There is a style check warning with the line:

  connect(this, SIGNAL(SetPlaymodeComboBox(int)),
          comboBox, SLOT(setCurrentIndex(int)), Qt::QueuedConnection);

But if I try changing it to

  connect(this, SIGNAL(SetPlaymodeComboBox(int _index)),
          comboBox, SLOT(setCurrentIndex(int _index)), Qt::QueuedConnection);

the playmode update no longer works.

values.description:
This fixes the problem where agent spawns in the middle of the field (before beaming). Now each agent spawns on their respective sides in the corner. 

![z.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/A9ekGz/images/3287237921-z.jpg)
values.title: Fix for Issue #24 (Agent spawning in middle of field)

summary.raw:
This fixes the problem where agent spawns in the middle of the field (before beaming). Now each agent spawns on their respective sides in the corner. 

![z.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/A9ekGz/images/3287237921-z.jpg)
summary.html: This fixes the problem where agent spawns in the middle of the field (before beaming). Now each agent spawns on their respective sides in the corner.

values.description:
Changed reference system to which the polar (spherical) coordinates are calculated.
Polar coordinates are now: radius, azimuth, elevation; with elevation as angle from the horizontal plane (with positive values above the horizontal plane) and both angles in degrees.

Changed head yaw joint axis in nao-Type-0 to match rotation direction in SimSpark.

* Created new branch sphere_to_cart_fix

* Use the same polar coordinates as SimSpark in vision perceptor.

    * Changed Geometry::CartToSphere and Geometry::SphereToCart to Geometry::CartToPolar and Geometry::PolarToCart and adapted calculations to match the SimSpark convention. Polar coordinates in SimSpark are of the following format: radius, azimuth, elevation; where elevation is the angle to the horizontal plane (with positive values above the horizontal plane).
    * Adapted Geometry test to new CartToPolar and PolatToCart methods.

* Fixed direction of head yaw joint in nao-type-0.

    * Changed direction of head yaw joint axis from (0, 0, -1) to (0, 0, 1) to match the definition in SimSpark.
values.title: Adjusted vision perception to match SimSpark convention.

summary.raw:
Changed reference system to which the polar (spherical) coordinates are calculated.
Polar coordinates are now: radius, azimuth, elevation; with elevation as angle from the horizontal plane (with positive values above the horizontal plane) and both angles in degrees.

Changed head yaw joint axis in nao-Type-0 to match rotation direction in SimSpark.

* Created new branch sphere_to_cart_fix

* Use the same polar coordinates as SimSpark in vision perceptor.

    * Changed Geometry::CartToSphere and Geometry::SphereToCart to Geometry::CartToPolar and Geometry::PolarToCart and adapted calculations to match the SimSpark convention. Polar coordinates in SimSpark are of the following format: radius, azimuth, elevation; where elevation is the angle to the horizontal plane (with positive values above the horizontal plane).
    * Adapted Geometry test to new CartToPolar and PolatToCart methods.

* Fixed direction of head yaw joint in nao-type-0.

    * Changed direction of head yaw joint axis from (0, 0, -1) to (0, 0, 1) to match the definition in SimSpark.

Changed reference system to which the polar (spherical) coordinates are calculated. Polar coordinates are now: radius, azimuth, elevation; with elevation as angle from the horizontal plane (with positive values above the horizontal plane) and both angles in degrees.

Changed head yaw joint axis in nao-Type-0 to match rotation direction in SimSpark.

  • Created new branch sphere_to_cart_fix

  • Use the same polar coordinates as SimSpark in vision perceptor.

    • Changed Geometry::CartToSphere and Geometry::SphereToCart to Geometry::CartToPolar and Geometry::PolarToCart and adapted calculations to match the SimSpark convention. Polar coordinates in SimSpark are of the following format: radius, azimuth, elevation; where elevation is the angle to the horizontal plane (with positive values above the horizontal plane).
    • Adapted Geometry test to new CartToPolar and PolatToCart methods.

  • Fixed direction of head yaw joint in nao-type-0.

    • Changed direction of head yaw joint axis from (0, 0, -1) to (0, 0, 1) to match the definition in SimSpark.

values.description:
Reducing the source code a bit. We can use conversions which are built into Gazebo instead of implementing our own functions:

* `G2I` can be done with `<gazebo math class>.Ign()`

* `I2G` is done implicitly
values.title: Remove G2I and I2G in favor of built-in conversions

summary.raw:
Reducing the source code a bit. We can use conversions which are built into Gazebo instead of implementing our own functions:

* `G2I` can be done with `<gazebo math class>.Ign()`

* `I2G` is done implicitly
summary.html:
Reducing the source code a bit. We can use conversions which are built into Gazebo instead of implementing our own functions:

  • G2I can be done with <gazebo math class>.Ign()

  • I2G is done implicitly

values.description:
To fix some style warnings in Ubuntu Xenial:

```
#!c++


[include/robocup3ds/ClientAgent.hh:45]: (style) Class 'ActionResponse' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.
[include/robocup3ds/Perceptors.hh:37]: (style) Class 'Perceptor' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.
[include/robocup3ds/Effector.hh:46]: (style) Class 'Effector' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.
[include/robocup3ds/Effector.hh:141]: (style) Class 'MonitorEffector' has a constructor with 1 argument that is not explicit.
```
values.title: Add explicit modifier in some class constructors
